intro: Beadlea congesta, commonly known as the clustered beadlea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Beadlea congesta typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
